title: Application of 3D printing for fabrication of superhydrophobic surfaces with reversible wettability
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,17684-17695
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA02742F, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Wenxuan Zhao, Yanlong Zhan, Wen Li, Saisai Hao, Alidad Amirfazli
This paper presents the preparation of superhydrophobic surfaces using FDM 3D printing technology. The wetting behavior of water droplets on the original and deformed surface can be reversibly changed between sliding and stick states.
